data.title: Just OK
data.text: This museum is designed for hands on activities for toddlers to pre-teens.  It's a bit expensive and there are not a ton of staff available, but it's a place for rainy or cold days when you have a bunch of kids that need to get out.  Not quite a great place, especially when you've been to lots of other cities children's museums, but it's OK for Grand Rapids.

data.title: Fun for all!
data.text: With the changing displays and fun activities, the Children's Museum is always a new adventure. The staff is friendly and the museum is clean. It's a wonderful way to spend a cold, snowy day!

data.title: Fun for all
data.text: Great for kids up to about grade 3.  After that, they might not be quite as interested.  Below that age, they will have a ball with all the hands on things to do!

data.title: Not bad, but not great
data.text: I appreciate the fact that GR has a children's museum, but it could be much better, considering the quality of all of the other museums in town.  Also overpriced, $35 for two adults (who do nothing but watch), and two kids, 5 and 6.  Yes, there are some unique items and activities, but I wasn't really overly impressed.  Meijer Gardens is much more worthwhile.

data.title: Fun Museum
data.text: My little kids enjoy this Museum! Great for the young ones as well as elementary & middle school aged kids! The bubble area is probably the most fun! I like the little "town" they have too! Grocery shopping, pizza making, bank teller, etc. So cool for the kids & adults!

data.title: Kids loved it . . . parents enjoyed it too!
data.text: We visit Children's Museum's when we travel quite often and this one was great!  Kids and parents had a blast.  The bubble area was a favorite area, but they loved the construction zone as well.  Thanks for providing a fun, safe place for kids to play and learn.

data.title: Great Rainy Day Activity
data.text: This museum is a great place for those little hands that want to touch all the buttons, jump, explore and move.  The other parents were a great help as we struggled to make the giant bubbles. My only concern was there were not many museum staff.

data.title: Super fun for my almost 3 yr old but not my 1 yr old.
data.text: We really found this museum to be super fun for our little boy, who is almost 3. He didn't want to leave at closing time. However, my 1 yr old didn't really have much to do. The areas her "size" were basically just putting balls in holes, books, blocks, stairs, and a small walk over bridge type thing. Not very exciting and not anything she couldn't have done at home. We were able to do some other things with her in the bigger kid areas like pushing buttons in the rescue helicopter. Mostly everything is for older children. It is a bummer too that we had to pay the same price for all of us to go, $8.50. I mostly walked around helping my children do things. I wish the pricing were different like half price a child with a paying adult or something along those lines.

data.title: So much fun with our kids!
data.text: We brought friends from out of town and they loved it!  So much fun stuff to do, the kids played for hours.  Highly recommend!

data.title: perfect stop!
data.text: The museum was two levels of fun!  Our four year old had a blast and our 11month old loved this kiddy area.

data.title: Filthy dirty
data.text: dirty dirty really cant keep a place we take our kids to clean would not recommend. Also  some people brought in some very stinky food and adults were using the kids picnic table to eat on and smell the place up this was not a place to be eating at very disappointed and you will be to

data.title: Pros and Cons
data.text: Con's - May take a long time driving around town, looking for a place to park. Meter parking has to be fed every two hours which is fine if you can find a parking space within 5-10 minute walk and you only want to stay for less than two hours. Or if you are with another adult who is willing to run out and feed the meter. There is a pay lot on one side of museum but not cheap. Adults have to pay to get into museum too so can get spendy. If you want to get your money's worth you will want to stay longer than 2 hours plus there is so much for the kids to do, you will want to stay at least three hours to get it all in. Can get busy,loud, and messy. Toys/items may not be in the right play station, especially on Thur. discount night.   Pro's -Very friendly staff -happy to welcome you in, answer questions and direct you to where you want to go. Although it can get busy it is not necessarily crowded. There is ample space in and between stations. Variety of age related stations making it fun and engaging for all ages. My kids were on the older side- age 9 and 12, they had fun in the bubble area, bee area, drums, and constrruction zone as well as few of the many manipulative stations. Seems like majority of the stations attract the younger age- toddler to 7 yr. age group. There is really so many  different places for the kids to go that every child, no matter what age, will find something that will interest them.  Even the adults will have fun. Thursday night is family discount night 5-8 $1.75 ea. and you don't have to pay the parking meters after 5.  Bathrooms are set up for the kids in mind (toilets, sinks, soap and dryers @ their level)

data.title: Great time
data.text: This museum was amazing. My nieces loved it and so did I.  They are use to going to a museum close to our home which is smaller.  So much to do and see.  definitely worth the money and time spent there.

data.title: wonderful for kids from toddlers to 10 years old
data.text: fantastic 2 floor museum with so many great things for kids to do. my 2 y and 8 y grandchildren both enjoyed various aspect of it. Basically many play stations to teach science and experiences. not cheap but they have a  very reasonable family membership and will apply your visit cost toward it ...special event..made their own ice cream and ate it at 11am!!

data.title: Excellent for little ones!
data.text: We visited this place on a Friday afternoon with our 2 little ones (4 & 1 1/2) what a great place to take kids and spend a few hours! Nicely laid out. Plenty of toys and creative spaces for kids to enjoy. My boys could have stayed hours just playing with all the colorful balls. In my opinion it's well worth the $ to get in even for mom & dad. If this place was close to home we would definitely purchase a yearly membership. The only things I can think of is the safety factor of no barriers on top floor near stairs to prevent little ones from falling down steps & nothing in place safety wise to prevent someone from going out front door with your kid (other than 1 young girl sitting on a stool). The only thing that would make it better would be a coffee bar. Then again we are supposed to be watching our kids anyhow and engaging in playtime. For me to sit and keep my boys entertained for a few hours it's a great deal!

data.title: My little one loves it!
data.text: So much for the kids to do and so many kids! I recommend going first thing in the morning before it gets too busy. Toys and children EVERYWHERE and lots of noise! Bring Tylenol if that sort of thing bothers you. Other than that, your kids will have a great time.

data.title: Cute Place
data.text: Went here last week with my family with kids ranging from 6-13 years in age. The place was fun for them- they had a great time. We had free tickets. I think I would have been disappointed had we paidd to get in.

data.title: Fun
data.text: We had a 3 year old and a 23 month old with us. There are many activities that are appropriate for many age groups. There are several bubble stations. You can make giant bubbles or even put yourselves in a bubble! There are many things to build with from magnetic pieces, wood, kinetics. You can build a roadway with a wooden track. Cardboard boxes make many structures. Many musical instruments to try from piano to drums. There is a light stick board. There is a fun area on the main floor that involves food. You can pretend to make food or pizza in a restaurant, shop at a grocery store with a check out, and cars to deliver it in.

data.title: Great museum for hands-on kids!
data.text: This museum was a great space for little ones, there was so much to do and see on the two levels.  We loved how the open floor plan just let kids go from activity to activity.  Our kiddos got a kick out of a lot they had to offer.  It was the perfect size for young ones and to see a lot in a few hours.

data.title: AMAZING for kids!
data.text: With two floors of activities, young kids can keep themselves busy for hours. The museum also has seasonal attractions and weekly, hands on activities. One of my favorite special events so far was spring break week, in which the museum hosted performers like a magician, in order to keep kids busy (and parents sane) while they were out of school for the week. The only downside is a somewhat expensive entry fee. If you're a local, go with the membership for sure. With young kids, it'll pay for itself many times over.
